result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J. Axelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

May be served on GPS electronic monitoring. Huber granted for employment, counseling and medical appointments.**Ordered on 09-07-16: Must commence jail sentence by 11-14-16.**
Concurrent with: with 15CF227

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth J. Axelson in court.  
Both files heard: 15CF227, 15CF313
1:16 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court reviews the file.  
Court questions the defendant. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court.  Waiting for SS payment to come so he can pay for home monitoring.  Expects the first check within 6 weeks. 

BY THE COURT:  Jail sentences to commence within 150 days of the date of conviction.  Must commence by November 14th, 2016.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth J. Axelson
Current: 2262 Sunset Lake Road, Amherst Junction, WI 54407 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2015)
Prior: 2262 Shunset Lake Road, Amherst Junction, WI 54407 United States
letter from defendant in regards to requesting additional 90 days for reporting for electronic monitor - original filed in 15CF227
Sentence adjustment review on September 7, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenneth J. Axelson
Current: 2262 Shunset Lake Road, Amherst Junction, WI 54407 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2015)
Prior: 280 Shannon Court, Apt. 4, Plover, WI 54467
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Kenneth J. Axelson in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-227 and 15CF-313.

1:39 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a sentencing hearing today. Defendant previously plead.

Court ordered a PSI. Copies were forwarded to counsel.  

Atty Knaapen has no corrections from a factual standpoint.

Atty Drengler has reviewed the report with his client, has no corrections to state.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentencing recommendations.
State recommends in 15CF-227: Ct 1: 18 months in initial, 5 yrs extended supervision; Ct 4: 18 month in initial, 3 yrs extended, concurrent to Ct 1;
Ct 5: 12 months in initial, 12 months extended, concurrent to Ct 1 and Ct 4
State recommends in 15CF-313: 6 month jail sentence concurrent to 15CF-227.
Buy money is cost - $1,050, to be paid out of prison account, balance to be paid on extended supervision.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Drengler recommends upwards of 5 years probation with no jail time, possibility of early discharge, imposed and stayed prison sentence, 1 day credit. Eligible for substance abuse program.

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-227:
Count 1:
Prison sentence for a period of 5 years
Initial Confinement 2 years
Extended Supervision 3 years
Imposed and Stayed
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Eligible for substance abuse
Probation for a period of 4 years
Conditions:
Jail sentence for a period of 150 days, may be served on electronic monitor or home detention. 
Huber granted for employment, counseling and medical appointments
Jail sentence to commence within 90 days of today's date
1 day jail credit
Complete an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Complete a psychological assessment if one has been done and comply with treatment recommendations
Comply with other assessments treaments and programs as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and DOC
Sign necessary releases of information for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacies and/or treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription and unless Defendant is taking those controlled substances
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia
Pay all court ordered obligations while on probation
Submit DNA sample if not done so
Pay court costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Pay court cost of $1,050 (buy money) 

Count 4:
Prison sentence for a period of 4 years
Initial Confinement 2 years
Extended Supervision 2 years
Concurrent to Count 1 and any other sentence Defendant may be serving
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 3 years concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Jail sentence for a period of 150 days, may be served on electronic monitor or home detention. 
Huber granted for employment, counseling and medical appointments
Jail sentence to commence within 90 days of today's date
1 day jail credit
Concurrent to Count 1
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5:
Prison sentence for a period of 3 years
Initial Confinement 1.5 years
Extended Supervision 1.5 years
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 4 and any other sentence Defendant may be serving
Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 3 years concurrent to Count 1 and Count 4
Conditions:
Jail sentence for a period of 150 days, may be served on electronic monitor or home detention. 
Huber granted for employment, counseling and medical appointments
Jail sentence to commence within 90 days of today's date
1 day jail credit
Concurrent to Count 1 and Count 4
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-313:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for a period of 90 Days, concurrent to 15CF-227, may be served on GPS electronic monitoring
Huber granted for employment, counseling and medical appointments
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Due within 60 days or get on a payment plan

20 days in which to appeal the case.
Parties will keep their copies of the PSI report, reminded to keep them confidential.

2:23 PM Court is in recess.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth J. Axelson in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF227, 15CF313
2:04 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF227 Counts 1, 4 & 5 - NO CONTEST
15CF313 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF227 Counts 1, 4 & 5, 15CF313 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in are the following:  15CF227 Counts 2, 3 & 6 thru 11 and 15CF313 Count 2. 

Court orders PSI. 
PSI be completed by 6/3/2016 with copies forwarded to counsel. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
